info.title: Amazon Chime SDK Media Pipelines
info.description: The Amazon Chime SDK media pipeline APIs in this section allow software developers to create Amazon Chime SDK media pipelines that capture, concatenate, or stream your Amazon Chime SDK meetings. For more information about media pipleines, see Amazon Chime SDK media pipelines.

servers.description: The Amazon Chime SDK Media Pipelines multi-region endpoint
The Amazon Chime SDK Media Pipelines multi-region endpoint
The Amazon Chime SDK Media Pipelines endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The Amazon Chime SDK Media Pipelines endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

SourceType.description: Source type from which the media artifacts are captured. A Chime SDK Meeting is the only supported source.

SourceArn.description: ARN of the source from which the media artifacts are captured.

SinkType.description: Destination type to which the media artifacts are saved. You must use an S3 bucket.

SinkArn.description: The ARN of the sink type.

ClientRequestToken.description: The unique identifier for the client request. The token makes the API request idempotent. Use a unique token for each media pipeline request.

ChimeSdkMeetingConfiguration.description: The configuration object of the Amazon Chime SDK meeting for a specified media pipeline. SourceType must be ChimeSdkMeeting.

allOf.description: The source configuration for a specified media pipline.
The configuration for the artifacts in an Amazon Chime SDK meeting.

get.description: Returns a list of media pipelines.

parameters.name: next-token
parameters.description: The token used to retrieve the next page of results.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. Valid Range: 1 - 99.

Sources.description: An object that specifies the sources for the media concatenation pipeline.

Sinks.description: An object that specifies the data sinks for the media concatenation pipeline.

ClientRequestToken.description: The unique identifier for the client request. The token makes the API request idempotent. Use a unique token for each media concatenation pipeline request.

Tags.description: The tags associated with the media concatenation pipeline.

post.description: Creates a streaming media pipeline in an Amazon Chime SDK meeting.

ClientRequestToken.description: The token assigned to the client making the request.

Tags.description: The tags associated with the media pipeline.

parameters.name: mediaPipelineId
parameters.description: The ID of the media pipeline being deleted.

parameters.name: mediaPipelineId
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline that you want to get.

parameters.name: mediaPipelineId
parameters.description: The ID of the media pipeline to delete.

parameters.name: mediaPipelineId
parameters.description: The ID of the pipeline that you want to get.

get.description: Returns a list of media pipelines.

parameters.name: next-token
parameters.description: The token used to retrieve the next page of results.

parameters.name: max-results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. Valid Range: 1 - 99.

get.description: Lists the tags available for a media pipeline.

parameters.name: arn
parameters.description: The ARN of the media pipeline associated with any tags. The ARN consists of the pipeline's region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.

post.description: The ARN of the media pipeline that you want to tag. Consists of he pipeline's endpoint region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.

ResourceARN.description: The ARN of the media pipeline associated with any tags. The ARN consists of the pipeline's endpoint region, resource ID, and pipeline ID.

Tags.description: The tags associated with the specified media pipeline.

post.description: Removes any tags from a media pipeline.

ResourceARN.description: The ARN of the pipeline that you want to untag.

TagKeys.description: The key/value pairs in the tag that you want to remove.

allOf.description: A media pipeline object, the ID, source type, source ARN, sink type, and sink ARN of a media pipeline object.
The selected video streams for a specified media pipeline. The number of video streams can't exceed 25.

SourceConfiguration.description: Source configuration for a specified media pipeline.

allOf.description: The configuration for the audio artifacts.
The configuration for the video artifacts.
The configuration for the content artifacts.
Enables video compositing.
The key half of a tag.
The value half of a tag.

Tag.description: A key/value pair that grants users access to meeting resources.

allOf.description: A media concatenation pipeline object, the ID, source type, MediaPipelineARN, and sink of a media concatenation pipeline object.

The concatenation settings for the media pipeline in a configuration object.

The source configuration's media source type.
The configuration settings of the connector pipeline.

The sink configuration's RTMP configuration setttings.

MeetingEventsConcatenationConfiguration.description: The configuration object for an event concatenation pipeline.
